header.title: Eight arrests as thousands join school strikes over climate change
header.postText: Hundreds of thousands of people led by school children on strike marched in protests held across the UK, ramping up the calls for urgent action to tackle the climate crisis.', 'Pupils left lessons and lectures as part of a series of global climate strikes to push the total estimated numbers into the millions – making it one of the largest protests in history.', 'Organisers claim about 100,000 people took part in the central London rally, with more than 20,000 thought to have marched in Edinburgh and a further 10,000 in Brighton.', 'Although the protest was peaceful, Met Police made several arrests when a group blocked traffic on Lambeth Bridge later in the afternoon.', 'Seven were arrested for public order offences for breaching conditions set on the protest and a man was arrested under the Explosives Act for releasing a flare on the bridge.', 'In London, Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn told youngsters in the crowd: ‘You and a whole generation have brought the issue centre stage and I am absolutely delighted about that.’', 'He also criticised US President Donald Trump for his failure to act on climate change and said he wanted to work with Brazil’s President Jair Bolsonaro to preserve and protect the Amazon rainforest.', 'Green Party politician Caroline Lucas was also present and said the day of action felt like ‘a real uprising’.', 'The MP added: ‘It feels like there is a real sense from young people in particular that they simply won’t wait any longer.', '‘It is their future that is at stake and our generation, my generation is responsible for not having done nearly enough to address that.', '‘They have enormous moral authority when they tell us that.’', 'One of the protesters, Jessica Ahmed, 16, from Barnet, north London, said: ‘School is important but so is my future.’
